Class ManFunctions

java.lang.Object
  ManFunctions

public class ManFunctions
extends java.lang.Object

ManFunctions (Manual/Manipulation Function) class contains re-usable methods which generally manipulate Strings and also check their content.

Author:
Jamie Brindle (06352322) - Msc - Manchester Metropolitan University

Constructor Summary
protected ManFunctions()
          The Manfunctions constructor - takes no parameters

          Compares two strings to see if one stream is the same or a substring of another Created as the J2ME library doesn't contain a method for doing this

          Takes a String and returns a true or false boolean value depending on whether the String contains only numeral digits or not

Method Detail

contains

protected boolean contains(java.lang.String full,
                           java.lang.String searched)
Compares two strings to see if one stream is the same or a substring of another Created as the J2ME library doesn't contain a method for doing this

Parameters:
full - is the String we're comparing to
searched - is the String we're comparing with
Returns:
true if the two strings are the same or one is a subset of another

readFile

protected java.lang.String[] readFile(java.lang.String fileName)
Reads the contents of an entire text file into a single String and returns an array

Parameters:
fileName - is the filename and location of the text file we want to read
Returns:
inputArray each index of the array contains a line of the text file

splitString

protected java.lang.String[] splitString(java.lang.String aString,
                                         java.lang.String splitCondition)
Takes a String and splits it where the particular character is found and is stored in an array. the class 'Regex' is not included in the J2ME library

Parameters:
aString - is the string we want to split
splitCondition - - identifies where to split the string
Returns:
result which is an array

splitString

protected java.lang.String[] splitString(java.lang.String aString)
Takes a String and splits it where the colon (:), symbol is found the class 'Regex' is not included in the J2ME library

Parameters:
aString - is the string we want to split
Returns:
result which is an array

containsOnlyNumbers

public boolean containsOnlyNumbers(java.lang.String aString)
Takes a String and returns a true or false boolean value depending on whether the String contains only numeral digits or not

Parameters:
aString - is the string we want to test
Returns:
true if the String only contains numeral digits
